body_html:
It's not a bug. named_parameters never promised you that the retuned names are attribute names.

It's not common to delete child parameters by names. In fact, couldn't you just add_(param_train) here? And you should really wrap the whole thing in no_grad()
body_text:
It's not a bug. named_parameters never promised you that the retuned names are attribute names.
It's not common to delete child parameters by names. In fact, couldn't you just add_(param_train) here? And you should really wrap the whole thing in no_grad()
body:
It's not a bug. `named_parameters` never promised you that the retuned names are attribute names.

It's not common to delete child parameters by names. In fact, couldn't you just `add_(param_train)` here? And you should really wrap the whole thing in `no_grad()`
